title: Grafisk designer till Göteborgs stadsmission
description:
Göteborgs Stadsmission är en idéburen, ickevinstdrivande organisation som arbetar för att stödja människor som lever i utsatta livssituationer. Tillsammans vill vi skapa ett Göteborg där alla är inkluderade. En stad där vi möter människan, inte problemet.

### **OM OSS**


För att ytterligare förstärka vårt varumärke och öka vår insamling söker vi nu en grafisk designer. Du kommer att arbeta på Insamlings- och Kommunikationsavdelningen som ansvarar för insamling från privatpersoner, företag, stiftelser och fonder. Teamet ansvarar också för volontärsamordning samt för marknadsföring, opinionsbildning och kommunikation för alla verksamheter inom Göteborgs Stadsmission och består av specialister inom kommunikation, marknadsföring och försäljning. Rollen som grafisk designer är placerad i kommunikationsteamet och är en ny tjänst.

### **OM TJÄNSTEN**


Vill du skapa engagerande kommunikation som gör skillnad på riktigt? Är du en erfaren grafisk designer som vill använda din kreativitet till att stärka Göteborgs Stadsmissions varumärke och därmed stötta människor i utsatthet? Då kan detta vara tjänsten för dig!


Tillsammans med dina kollegor i teamet skapar du inspirerande och engagerande innehåll som ökar vår synlighet och bidrar till att öka vår insamling, så att vi kan hjälpa fler människor i utsatthet. Du skapar material för alla våra verksamheter i alla våra kommunikationskanaler – från digitala kanaler och kampanjer till annonser och trycksaker – och säkerställer att vårt budskap når ut och gör skillnad.


Med din erfarenhet av design utgår du från vår grafiska profil och vidareutvecklar såväl mallar som material och bildbank för att ytterligare förstärka vårt varumärke.


Hos oss får du möjlighet att göra en skillnad i människors liv och arbeta med något som spelar roll på riktigt. Du blir en del av ett härligt och professionellt team som har höga ambitioner och ett starkt driv att nå våra mål samtidigt som vi har kul tillsammans och stöttar varandra.

### **VEM ÄR DU?**

Vi söker dig som har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom grafisk design, eller annan utbildning vi bedömer likvärdig. Du har gedigen erfarenhet av Adobe Creative Cloud, särskilt InDesign, PhotoShop och Premiere Pro och arbetar obehindrat med både digitala och tryckta medier.


Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av att producera insamlings- eller säljdrivande innehåll.


Det är meriterande om du även har utbildning eller erfarenhet av kommunikation eller marknadsföring samt om du arbetat på reklambyrå.


För att trivas i rollen är du en prestigelös lagspelare som tar eget ansvar och driver dina uppgifter framåt. Du har lätt för att samarbeta och kan navigera i en organisation med många kontaktytor. Din kreativitet och förmåga att förstå våra givares och kunders behov är avgörande för att lyckas i denna roll.


Vi utgår ifrån att du som söker jobb hos oss delar vår syn att alla människor har rätt till en plats i vår stad, ett eget hem och en röst. Läs mer om vår värdegrund här www.stadsmissionen.org/om-oss.

### **PRAKTISK INFORMATION**


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på 100%.


Till din ansökan vill vi att du bifogar arbetsprover på kampanj/insamlingsrelaterat material du skapat.


Intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningsperioden.

  

Vi ser mångfald som en styrka och ser fram emot sökande med olika bakgrunder, intressen och erfarenheter. Välkommen med din ansökan! Vill du veta mer om Göteborgs Stadsmission? Hemsida: www.stadsmissionen.org Facebook: www.facebook.com/GbgStadsmission/ Linkedin: https://se.linkedin.com/company/g-teborgs-stadsmission Instagram: @gbgstadsmission @stadsmissionenssecondhand\_gbg @restaurangsvinn Vill du stödja Göteborgs stadsmissions arbete? www.stadsmissionen.org/ge-stod/. Till säljare av annonserings- och rekryteringstjänster Göteborgs Stadsmission gör aktiva val när det gäller var vi vill exponera våra platsannonser och vilket stöd vi vill ha i rekryteringen. Vi kommer inte att köpa tjänster eller annonsplats för en pågående rekrytering och ber er därför att inte kontakta oss med sådana erbjudanden.


Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Göteborg | Län: Västra Götalands län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/61 | Kontakt: Beatrice Mikaelsson, Kommunikationschef 031-7047353, | Publicerat: 2024-10-31 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-11-22

title: Associate Software Delivery Manager
description:
Change people’s lives and love what you do! Cochlear develops world-leading medical devices that help people hear. As a top 100 medical device company and market-leader in implantable hearing devices, more people choose a Cochlear-branded cochlear implant system than any other. Our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for Cochlear is the opportunity to make a difference to people’s lives.
Cochlear’s mission is to help people hear and be heard. As the global leader in implantable hearing solutions, Cochlear is dedicated to helping people with moderate to profound hearing loss experience a life full of hearing. We aim to give people the best lifelong hearing experience and access to innovative future technologies. We collaborate with the industry’s best clinical, research and support networks. That’s why more people choose Cochlear than any other hearing implant company. Learn and grow with us as we tackle the most complex challenges in helping more people to hear and experience life’s opportunities.
The Opportunity
Cochlear has an opportunity for an Associate Software Delivery Manager based in our Goteborg offices. In this role, the successful candidate will play a pivotal role in the R&D Customer Software team and will be responsible for ensuring consistent, sustained and regular delivery of high-quality applications within our product portfolio.
Responsibilities include:* Managing more than one concurrent high visibility project using agile methods in a fast-paced, highly regulated environment.
* Multiple responsibilities such as project management / scrum master activities in line with Cochlear’s Product Improvement Process.
* Working closely with the squads across Customer Software, R&D Systems, Services, and Information Technology to ensure that the R&D Customer Software meets and exceeds the needs of the business and customer needs.
* Working with various global stakeholders (spanning across R&D, IT, Services, Marketing and other groups across the organisation) to ensure alignment, co-ordination, planning, understand and manage dependencies, release management and support activities.


What makes this opportunity unique?
The Associate Software Delivery Manager will lead and motivate the day-to-day Agile execution with the team and will also maintain expert knowledge in software engineering the application of software for medical devices and medical device data systems.
You will connect cross-functionally across the business to gather and manage inputs that feed into product design and continue to liaise through the product development and delivery process and be the external facing point of contact for the team to the rest of the business.
About You. As we grow, we are looking for people who share our passion for delivering quality hearing solutions to our customers. To add value to Cochlear in this role, you'll be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:
Essential* Knowledge of and exposure to application and/ or cloud software product development
* 3+ years’ experience in project management or software team management
* Proven experience providing project delivery and team leadership in a software product development or engineering environment
* Ability to motivate and facilitate cross-functional teams in order to deliver projects on time and within budget
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to work with other project team members
* Bachelor's degree or combination of relevant education and experience
* Proven experience in influencing, managing, and building alignment between a range of senior, cross functional stakeholders. Team focused. Good at managing relationships and looking out for the needs of the team
* Proven ability to operate at the intersection of technology and business to maximise effectiveness with shaping product
* Strong interest to work across various types of projects (desktop software, mobile apps, firmware and hardware projects) and across various disciplines.
* Strong interest in the Agile project management discipline.
* Very strong customer service orientation.


Desired Skills* Experience working in Agile software development
* Working knowledge of the principles of project management
* Continuous improvement focus: how to make processes more scalable and efficient
* Strong understanding of product design principals
* Experience working on projects in a regulated environment.


A Little About Cochlear
Cochlear’s mission is to help people hear and be heard. Around the world, more people chose a Cochlear-branded hearing implant system than any other. Our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for Cochlear is the opportunity to make a difference to people’s lives. Learn and grow with us as we tackle the most complex challenges in helping people to Hear Now. And Always. Cochlear is the global market leader in implantable hearing solutions including cochlear implant systems (CI) and bone anchored hearing aids (Baha™).
#cochlearcareers #TogetherCochlear
company_description: At Cochlear hearing is our passion. As the global leader in implantable hearing solutions we help people to Hear Now. And Always.

title: ERP Business Analyst – Finance
description:
**Overview ... :**  

At JBT, what we do matters. As one of the global leaders within food and beverage technology and automated systems, we know that the contribution of our employees, ultimately leads to the success of our business fortifying the future of food. We are committed to our employees and will provide you with development and opportunities to allow you to be the best version of yourself at work, at home, and in your community. We foster a genuine inclusive team culture enjoying collaborative working across our global teams to deliver world-class projects. We encourage development ensuring new experiences and challenges at JBT in order to feed your growth!
  
  

**The Opportunity ... :**  

The position of ERP Business Analyst has become an urgent requirement at our site in Helsingborg Sweden with expertise within the Finance module in LN.
  
  

We are looking for an ERP Business Analyst with Infor LN CloudSuite Industrial (version 10.8 but 10.5 with cloud based multi-site locations will also work). Reporting into our ERP Support Lead based in the US, your responsibilities will help support and shape our LN ERP system. We need operational understanding of LN A/P Processing, A/R Processing, and Integration Mapping.
  
  

**On any give day, you may:**  

* Handle master data, codes, parameters, and settings in the system.
* Maintain user management SOPs.
* Communicate with teams across management, operations, and finance at various levels.
* Provide training and troubleshooting support for users.
* Ensure data verification and integrity, expanding as new sources and outputs are added.
* Develop solutions for the client's BI platform.
* Coordinate with the ERP Support Manager on project priorities and timelines.
* Serve as the link between data collection and BI output.
* Collaborate with IT support teams.


**Role Requirements:**  

* Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science, or related field.
* Minimum 5 years of experience with Infor LN (Infor LN CloudSuite Industrial Enterprise 10.5+).
* Experience in Functional Specification Documentation.
* Proficiency in Tableau; Microsoft Azure is a plus.
* Understanding of high-level database concepts and system testing.
* Project management experience is advantageous.
* Ability to access information through data access layers.
* Familiarity with data table structures and implementation.
* Expertise in modules: AP, AR, General Ledger, Cash Management, Project Accounting, and Fixed Assets.
* Knowledge in Procurement, Service, and Manufacturing.
* Team player with the ability to work globally across cultures and businesses.


Travel & Location
  
  

* This is a site-based support position located at our site in Helsingborg Sweden.


**Why work at JBT ... :**  

We are committed to our employees and will provide you with development and opportunities to allow you to be the best version of yourself at work, at home, and in your community.
  
  

We foster a genuine inclusive team culture enjoying collaborative working across our global teams to deliver world-class projects.
  
  

We encourage development ensuring new experiences and challenges at JBT to feed your growth!
  
  

**Our Benefits:** The salary and benefits package will be competitive with current Swedish market standards.
  
  

**Commitment to Diversity:** Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging is a fundamental value to JBT and critical to our future success. A thoughtful, focused, and sustained effort to work towards our DEIB goals is not just a principled choice, but also a business imperative.
  
  

**Equal Opportunity Employment:** John Bean Technologies Corporation (“JBT”) provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and qualified applicants for employment. We will not tolerate any form of discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. At JBT, we apply this policy to all our employment practices, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, benefits, and training. We make hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit and business needs at the time. JBT will reasonably accommodate applicants who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. If you require assistance or accommodation during the application process, please speak to your local HR or Talent Acquisition.
  
  

#LI-SW1 #LI-Onsite
company_description: JBT is a leading global technology solutions provider to high-value segments of the food & beverage industry with a focus on proteins, liquid foods, and automated Guided Vehicles (AGVs).

title: Senior Field Application Engineer
description:
**Title: Senior Field Application Engineer****Location: Kista, Sweden****WIND RIVER**
Wind River is a global leader in delivering software for mission-critical intelligent systems. For more than four decades, the company has been an innovator and pioneer, powering billions of systems that require the highest levels of security, safety, and reliability.

Wind River helps customers across automotive, aerospace, defense, industrial, medical, and telecommunications industries solve complex technology challenges on their journey toward the new intelligent machine economy. The company’s software powers generation after generation of the safest, most secure systems in the world. Examples include playing a key role in NASA space missions — such as Artemis I, the James Webb Space Telescope, and multiple Mars rovers — and in recent 5G milestones — including the world’s first successful 5G data session with Verizon and in building one of the largest Open RAN networks in the world with Vodafone.

The company has received industry recognition for its technology innovation and leadership, and for its workplace culture, including global Great Place to Work certification and being named a “Top Workplace” for ten consecutive years. If you want to be part of a unique culture where the lived experience is based on our cultural attributes of growth mindset, customer-focus, and diversity, equity, inclusion & belonging, come join us and help advance the future software defined world.
**ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY**
I**nnovation**

Are you a curious and collaborative engineer, someone that is excited about working on new and innovative solutions utilizing technology that is at the forefront of the industry? Do you want to be part of the Digital Transformation wave that is happening today? This is an exciting time to be at Wind River! You will have an opportunity to sharpen your skills in Linux and Kubernetes, while working with the leading companies in the industry.
**Interface & Collaboration**Working with the leading provider of integrated embedded software solutions, you will work with some of the most talented engineers in the industry to draft technical solutions to challenging problems.

As our customers look to gain a competitive advantage in this digital first world, they are looking to companies like Wind River to partner with in their journey. Wind River is answering this call through our delivery of the world’s first Cloud Native Environment that enables developers of intelligent edge devices to transform and optimize their device life cycle from Development to Deployment, to Operations, and Servicing.

Your opportunity is to join as a key member of highly talented and motivated, customer facing field engineering team. You will be responsible for understanding our customers' business and technical needs and to work with them in the capacity of technical evangelist and trusted advisor in crafting the next generation Intelligent systems.
**Responsibilities*** Understand your customer’s technical requirements, design technical solutions, and showcase them through product presentations, discovery workshops, proof of concepts, and evaluations, to secure the technical sale.
* Be the customer facing evangelist by guiding your customers through their Digital Transformation journey.
* Partner closely with your Account Manager and be focused on hunting for new business.
* Manage all aspects of the technical needs of the assigned territory utilizing all available resources.
* Increase Wind River market share with your customers.
* Manage Trade Shows and Seminars.

**ABOUT YOU****Core Competencies & Demonstrated Success**
The ideal candidate will have 10+ years of software development and solutions architecting, with experience in the following areas:* Direct, hands-on experience with Linux. Experience with Yocto and Debian is advantageous.
* Experience with Cloud Native technologies including Kubernetes, containers, microservices, etc.
* Programming skills in the C or C++ language is essential, and experience or interest in the following are desirable: Python, Rust, Java, etc.
* Demo development and delivery experience (internal and/or external).
* Experience with DevSecOps development methodologies including an understanding of tools such as Gitlab, Jenkins, Docker etc.
* Experience working with the telecommunications industry.

  


**Qualifications**
* BSCS or BSEE is required.
* Software development experience.
* Excellent communication skills exhibited through white boarding, technical presentations, white papers, and demonstrations.
* Experience interfacing with internal and/or external customers.
* Experience responding to customer RFPs is desirable.
* Excellent time management skills and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Demonstrated self-starter and able to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to travel to customers and trade shows, when required, within EMEA.
* Positive Attitude.
* Strong growth mindset, continuous learner, and adaptive to the Wind River culture.
company_description: Wind River is a global leader in delivering software for mission-critical intelligent systems.

title: Marknadskoordinator
description:
Är du en kreativ och initiativtagande koordinator inom kommunikation och marknadsföring som vill arbeta i en varierande och självgående roll? Tycker du det är spännande att arbeta med varumärkesbyggande marknadsföring och vill vara en del av ett snabbväxande företag? Då ska du söka tjänsten som marknadskoordinator till vår centrala marknadsavdelning på Swedish Agro!


VAD BLIR DU EN DEL AV?
  

Swedish Agro
  

På Swedish Agro skapar vi värde för svenskt lantbruk genom att vara en helhetsleverantör för den enskilda lantbrukaren och erbjuder insatsvaror, foder och maskiner av högsta kvalitet. Vi representerar branschens ledande maskinvarumärken CLAAS, HORSCH, METSJÖ, RAUCH, SPEARHEAD, SCANSTONE, AVR, AGXEED och DALBO och har en av Europas modernaste foderfabriker som tillverkar foder för flera djurslag. Vi har en gemensam tro på att vi är starkare tillsammans och arbetar för långsiktighet, kvalitet och lönsamhet.
  

Vi söker nu en driven och kreativ marknadskoordinator till vår centrala marknadsavdelning. Här kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att stärka Swedish Agro’s varumärke och stötta vår verksamhet med innovativa marknadsföringsinsatser i nära samarbete med ett team på tre personer.


DITT ANSVARSOMRÅDE
  

Som marknadskoordinator på Swedish Agro får du en varierande roll där du koordinerar och genomför marknadsförings- och kommunikationsaktiviteter både för interna och externa mottagare. Du arbetar nära marknadsteamet och andra avdelningar för att skapa engagerande kommunikation som resonerar med vår målgrupp och säkerställa att kommunikationen är enhetlig och samordnad. I marknadsteamet delar vi våra insikter med varandra för att förbättra marknadsföringsstrategier och har ett nära samarbete i prioritering av arbetsuppgifter och projekt. Du har möjlighet att själv forma rollen utifrån dina kompetenser samt driva och utveckla förbättringsprojekt. Dina ansvarsområden kommer bland annat att inkludera:


Content marketing:


* Planera, skapa och publicera innehåll som artiklar och inlägg för hemsida och sociala medier.
* Hantera och följa upp kampanjer för att mäta effektivitet och engagemang.

Grafisk produktion:


* Designa visuellt innehåll för annonser, broschyrer och annat tryckmaterial samt säkerställa att allt grafiskt material följer våra varumärkesriktlinjer.

Webbredigering:


* Löpande producera och publicera SEO-anpassat material på vår hemsida

Projektledning:


* Koordinera olika marknadsföringsaktiviteter samt säkerställa att alla projekt genomförs enligt tidsplan och är i linje med våra strategiska mål.

Digital marknadsföring:


* Stötta digitala kampanjer samt driva digitala utvecklingsprojekt.
* Analysera resultat och optimera marknadsinsatser baserat på data

I rollen som marknadskoordinator arbetar du bland annat även med film och fotografering där du producerar och redigerar material samt deltar i planeringen och genomförandet av event, mässor och liknande aktiviteter där tjänsteresor kan förekomma. Du rapporterar till marketing- och kommunikationschefen och utgår ifrån vårt huvudkontor i Skurup. Tjänsten gäller tillsvidare, heltid med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån någon dag i veckan.


DIN PROFIL
  

Vi söker en kreativ och initiativrik person med god samarbetsförmåga då du kommer att arbeta med många kontaktytor inom företaget samt våra leverantörer och kunder. Du trivs med att arbeta strukturerat och hålla deadlines, samtidigt som du har öga för detaljer och kvalitet. Du har en positiv inställning, eget driv och ett engagemang för att skapa innehåll för många olika kanaler. Du tycker det är roligt att skapa innehåll, inklusive rörligt material anpassat för sociala medier. Du har även förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team, med flera projekt igång samtidigt. Vi lägger stor vikt på dina personliga egenskaper och drivkrafter. Vidare ser vi att du har:


* Utbildning inom kommunikation och/eller marknadsföring
* Erfarenhet från liknande roller eller arbetsuppgifter
* Kunskaper i Microsoft Office, Adobe Creative Cloud, AI och sociala medieplattformar
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Bakgrund eller erfarenhet inom lantbruksbranschen är meriterande, men inget krav

VI ERBJUDER
  

Starkare tillsammans
  

På Swedish Agro bygger vår grund på samarbete och vi har en grundläggande tro att vi är starkare tillsammans. Vi erbjuder därmed en arbetsplats där vi utvecklas tillsammans – över avdelningar, kompetenser och landsgränser. Våra medarbetare är vår viktigaste resurs och vi strävar efter att skapa de bästa förutsättningarna för trivsel, engagemang och inflytande.


ÄR DU INTRESSERAD?
  

Så ansöker du
  

Om du tycker att tjänsten låter spännande, skicka gärna din ansökan redan idag eller så snart som möjligt genom att klicka på ”ANSÖK”. Vi räknar med att hålla intervjuer löpande och kan komma att avbryta sökandet när rätt kandidat har hittats.
  

Vi tror att mångfald stärker lösningen av uppgifter. Vi uppmanar därför alla intresserade – oavsett bakgrund – att söka tjänsten. Vi hoppas att höra från dig!


EN INTERNATIONELL KONCERN
  

Vi vill skapa värde! För lantbruket, för lantbrukaren och för våra medarbetare.
  

Swedish Agro är en del av Danish Agro-koncernen, med mer än 5 000 kollegor fördelat på 100 företag i 15 länder. Från fältet till skärmen är våra medarbetare kärnan i vår förmåga att skapa värde och utveckla framtidens lantbruk och säkerställa att vi kan spela en avgörande roll i branschens digitala och gröna omställning – och att vi varje dag hjälper lantbrukaren att odla mat i världsklass. Detta gör vi genom att stärka, odla och utveckla branschen – och inte minst varandra. Och vi behöver dig också!
  

Är du mer nyfiken på Danish Agro- koncernen? Se vår koncernfilm här!

title: Infrastrukturspecialist Datacenter
description:
* Ansök senast: 30 november 2024
* Flera platser
* Hybrid
**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------

  

  

*Kom och bygg samhällskritisk IT-infrastruktur med världens skönaste gäng! Vi tar hand om hela stacken från fysisk hårdvara upp till virtualiseringsplattformen. Tele2 söker nu en Infrastrukturtekniker som vill vara en viktig del av Hybrid Cloud Solutions driftorganisation. Vårt dedikerade team arbetar inom B2B-sektorn med ett flertal kunder inom samhällskritiska verksamheter, både inom den privata och offentliga sektorn. Detta är en spännande resa där du har möjlighet att påverka och kontinuerligt utvecklas.*



På Tele2 Företag (B2B) arbetar vi varje dag för att möjliggöra ett samhälle med obegränsade möjligheter genom vår breda portfölj av it- och telekomrelaterade produkter och tjänster. Med ett team av kunniga experter hjälper vi kunder inom privat och offentlig sektor att digitalisera sin verksamhet, bli mer hållbara och uppnå sin affärspotential. Vi söker nu en ny medarbetare till vårt framgångsrika team som bidrar till vår tillväxt, förstklassiga kundupplevelser och högt engagemang.


**Om rollen**  

  

Som en del av teamet HCS (Hybrid Cloud Solutions) Infrastructure driftorganisation, kommer du att fokusera på den underliggande driftplattformen för centrala tjänster. Vi befinner oss i en expansiv fas och det kommer finnas stora möjligheter till utveckling och att få jobba brett inom området.



Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden kommer inkludera:


* Drift och underhåll av befintliga virtuella plattformar och lagringslösningar
* Uppsättning och installation av nya miljöer
* Vara med i olika projekt som resurs
* Optimering och kontinuerligt förbättringsarbete
* Tjänsteleveranser
* Beredskap ingår i tjänsten


Det här är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Vi ser helst att du kan arbeta från något av följande Tele2 kontor:  

Kista, Göteborg, Malmö eller Halmstad, vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsplats.

**Vem är du?**



För att du skall trivas och bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du har:


* Erfarenhet från arbete med datacenterlösningar
* Ett par års erfarenhet av VMWare och/eller Hyper-V
* Erfarenhet av serverdrift
* Erfarenhet av SAN-lösningar, backuplösningar (Veeam)
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska



Meriterande


* Erfarenhet av HCI lösningar så som Nutanix AHV
* Grundläggande nätverkskunskap
* Erfarenhet inom public cloud – Azure och/eller AWS
* Relevanta certifieringar

Som person ser vi att du har ett eget driv och kan ta initiativ. Vidare ser vi att du kan arbeta strukturerat inom ett team och är en fena på teknisk problemlösning. Det är också viktigt att du delar våra värderingar, Reliable, Insight driven och Collaborative. Detta innebär att vi levererar det vi har lovat både till kunder och kollegor, vi ser ett end to end perspektiv för att skapa ett fokus på våra kunder och vi tror på samarbete och kompetensöverföring. Du är inte rädd för att driva din åsikt, men samtidigt är du lyhörd och flexibel.



**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------


* Pension and health care
* Hybrid and flexible work life balance
* Career opportunities
* Parental benefit
* Employee benefits and Tele2 discounts
* Inclusive workplace
* Stora utbildningsmöjligheter
* Tydliga karriärvägar och utvecklingsmöjligheter
* Lön och försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal
* Generöst förmånspaket
* Inkluderande arbetskultur där alla är välkomna
* Rabatter på Tele2s produkter och tjänster
* Convenient parking next to our office in Kista
* Leading in technology
* Tjänstepension

Vi fortsätter att uppnå nya mål och vi hjälper våra kunder att uppnå sina hållbarhetsmål eftersom vi åtagit oss att övergå till en cirkulär ekonomi.


**Intresse och ansökan**



Vill du bli en del av Tele2s värderingsstyrda och inkluderande företagskultur? Tryck då på “ansök” och låt oss ta reda på om vi är en match!



Om du har några specifika frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare på [email protected]  

Vänligen notera dock att i enlighet med hantering av personuppgifter (GDPR) har vi inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via e-post.

**Några av våra medarbetare**
-----------------------------


Emma
Digital Capabilities & Technology
*"Everyone at Tele2 always aim for the stars in order to create unlimited possibilities."*
Marika
Head of IT Operational Excellence
*"We’re serious about what we do, and we get things done."*
Emma
Digital Capabilities & Technology
*"På Tele2 siktar vi högt för att skapa obegränsade möjligheter"*
Marika

----------------

title: Cloud Architect
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media and Software Development
description:
🌟 Join Our Team as an Azure Architect in Stockholm! 🌟
 



  





 📍 Location: Stockholm
 



 💼 Employment Type: Full-Time
 



 ❗ Swedish speaking is a must
 



  





 Are you an Azure expert with a flair for crafting top-notch cloud solutions and a talent for engaging with clients? We’re a specialist cloud consultancy in Stockholm, and we’re looking for a skilled Azure Architect to help us deliver exceptional results and shape the future of cloud transformations for our clients.
 



  





  





**What You’ll Do:** 




 As our Azure Architect, you’ll play a vital role in both technical architecture and pre-sales. You’ll work closely with clients to understand their unique needs, design tailored Azure solutions, and support them every step of the way. From initial consultation and solution scoping to implementing the architecture, you’ll be our go-to expert and a key part of our growth story.
 



  





  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




 - Pre-sales & Client Engagement: Conduct discovery sessions, create solution proposals, and present strategies that meet client needs and drive business value.
 



 - Solution Design & Architecture: Develop robust, scalable, and secure Azure architectures, incorporating best practices and leveraging the latest Azure offerings.
 



 - Collaborate & Innovate: Work with our skilled consultants and partners to deliver innovative solutions for a variety of industries.
 



 - Technical Leadership: Mentor colleagues and keep our team at the cutting edge of Azure technology.
 



  





  





**What We’re Looking For:** 




 - Expertise in Azure Architecture: Proven experience in designing and implementing Azure solutions, with strong knowledge of Azure services and cloud best practices.
 



 - Pre-Sales Savvy: Confidence in client-facing settings, with the ability to translate complex technical requirements into clear, compelling proposals.
 



 - Problem-Solving Mindset: Creative thinker who thrives on solving real-world challenges with cloud solutions.
 



 - Team Player: Comfortable collaborating with a tight-knit team of cloud specialists in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
 



  





  





**Why Join ?** 




 - Impactful Projects: Work on meaningful projects that make a real difference for our clients.
 



 - Career Growth: We’re committed to helping you grow with us, with opportunities for learning and professional development.
 



 - Inclusive Culture: Join a welcoming, open-minded team where every idea matters and collaboration is key.
 



  





  





 If you’re ready to take on a new challenge, lead Azure transformations, and enjoy the freedom of working with a specialist consultancy, apply now and help us bring the future of cloud to life!
 



  





 This is a brief description of the role, for the full information, simply apply to the role and I will call you to discuss.
 



  





**Twitter:** 
 @\_NigelFrank
 



**LinkedIn:** 
 https://www.linkedin.com/in/sarah-king-624956160/
 



**Email:** 
 s.king@nigelfrank.com
 



**Phone:** 
 +358 75 326 6584
 



  





**Please Note:** 
 This is a permanent role. This role is for Swedish residents only. This role does not offer Sponsorship. You must have the right to work in Sweden with no restrictions. Some of our roles
 *may* 
 be subject to successful background/security checks.
 



  





 I will call you to discuss your skill-set further

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
RoadBird is a cutting-edge fintech platform transforming fleet management for the ride-share industry. With advanced payroll processing, operational insights, and a new drive-to-own initiative, we’re scaling rapidly and looking for a technical leader to guide our development.
 



  





**Role Summary** 




 As CTO, you’ll take full ownership of our code repositories and hosting environments, leading the development team and ensuring all systems are optimized for scalability and security. You’ll design, manage, and maintain RoadBird’s technical infrastructure, from CI/CD pipelines to API integrations, and champion AI applications in our products.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* **Repository & Environment Management** 
 : Full oversight of code repositories and hosting setups, ensuring optimal remote development workflows.
* **Development Team Leadership** 
 : Manage a high-performance coding team, setting standards for quality, scalability, and security.
* **CI/CD Pipeline Development** 
 : Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD processes, with packaging knowledge across diverse environments.
* **Cloud Infrastructure** 
 : Extensive experience with AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, including billing, budgeting, and cost optimization.
* **Security** 
 : Expertise with OpenSSL, certificate deployment, dynamic credential storage, and secure environment variable setups.
* **API Development** 
 : Deep understanding of APIs, structured JSON, and multi-layered API integrations.
* **AI Engineering** 
 : Advanced knowledge in prompt and system prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and AI model development.
* **Data Handling** 
 : Skilled in parsing and processing data from CSV, XLS, JSON, web scraping, and other formats.



  





**Technical Skills** 



* **Programming Languages** 
 : Proficiency in Python, Java, Scala, JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and frameworks in each.
* **Cloud & DevOps** 
 : Strong experience with AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud, including setup, scaling, and optimization.
* **Security Protocols** 
 : Advanced understanding of OpenSSL, certificate management, and secure environment configurations.



  





**Qualifications** 



* **Experience** 
 : Proven track record in senior technology roles, ideally within fintech or similar high-growth tech ventures in the Nordics or Europe.
* **Strategic Leadership** 
 : Ability to architect and implement scalable, resilient systems and infrastructures with a vision for future growth.
* **AI Innovation** 
 : Experience building AI applications with user-friendly interfaces and practical everyday utility, incorporating automated decision-making for efficient and intuitive outcomes.
* **Commitment** 
 : Full-time availability with no other significant engagements, dedicated to driving RoadBird’s technology roadmap.
* **Investment Readiness** 
 : Capacity to make a primary investment in RoadBird, ideally supported by capital from prior successful exits.



  





**Offering & Compensation** 



* **Base Salary** 
 : Competitive base salary, which will scale with RoadBird’s growth.
* **Equity Package** 
 : Ownership through a structured equity vesting schedule, sharing in the long-term success of the company.
* **High-Growth Environment** 
 : Join a company with substantial market potential, where you can make a significant impact.

title: Senior Hybrid Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   

  

 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Global Cloud Infrastructure Team is seeking a skilled Hybrid Cloud Operations Engineer to join our international team. As part of this dynamic team, you will play a key role in supporting our commercial offerings. Unit4 operates a sophisticated infrastructure spanning Microsoft Azure and on-premises data centers in Sweden. In this role, you will primarily work with Windows Server Virtual Machines deployed on VMware while also assisting in the setup of virtual networks and Azure native solutions.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Required:**
* 5+ years of relevant experience
* Deep knowledge of Windows Server architecture and Active Directory
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure
* Minimum 4 years experience with VMware and virtualization technologies
* Experience automating Windows systems using PowerShell or similar methods
* Hands-on experience with physical data centers, including cabling, moving components, etc.
* Flexibility to work outside of office hours and participate in weekend on-call support.
* Strong prioritization skills, both independently and as part of a team
* Proficient troubleshooting skills, with the ability to resolve complex issues
* Passion for learning new technologies and exploring innovative ideas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for engaging with internal and external customers


**Nice to Have:**
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure & Microsoft certifications
* Experience with Dell Servers, Cisco Network devices
* Knowledge of networking (VPN setup), file transfer servers, Microsoft SQL, and PKI infrastructure
* Experience with AWS


**Additional Information**
 A chance to participate in the development of a leading global software firm. You have the opportunity to work within an organization, that gives you the freedom and autonomy to be successful. An attractive salary while working in a challenging international environment with enthusiastic colleagues who like to learn from each other.
   

  

 At Unit4 we invest in your personal and professional growth. We don't focus on how many days you work, we trust you on delivering results - thus, we have an unlimited vacation policy.
   

  

**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**

title: Data Scientist
company_industry: Entertainment Providers and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**RUN** 
 is a data-driven music investment company with offices in Stockholm and Los Angeles. We empower independent artists by providing upfront payments for licensing their music, utilizing a transparent, algorithm-driven model. At RUN, we value creativity, diversity, and collaboration, striving to create a workplace where everyone feels welcome and valued.
 



  





**What You'll Do:** 



* **Develop Predictive Models:** 
 Create and refine statistical models to forecast market dynamics and artist performance, directly influencing our investment strategies.
* **Build Machine Learning Solutions:** 
 Design and deploy machine learning models to predict music trends, contributing to our innovative approach in the music industry.
* **Create Scalable Data Pipelines:** 
 Efficiently process and manage large datasets, ensuring seamless access to insights for the team.
* **Collaborate in a Diverse Environment:** 
 Work closely with a motivated and inclusive team, enhancing our high-performing culture through diverse perspectives.
* **Uncover Insights:** 
 Analyze data to extract meaningful insights and communicate findings in a clear, accessible manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* **Influence Company Culture:** 
 Be part of a small but growing team where your voice matters and where you can help shape both our technology and culture.



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 



* **Experience:** 
 3+ years in data science and/or machine learning. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds who bring fresh perspectives and ideas.
* **Technical Skills:** 
 Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R, along with familiarity with machine learning tools and frameworks. We prioritize continuous learning and support your professional growth.
* **Creative Problem Solver:** 
 A detail-oriented thinker who enjoys tackling complex challenges and finding innovative solutions.
* **Strong Communicator:** 
 Excellent communication skills and a desire to work collaboratively in an inclusive and supportive environment.



  





**Bonus Points:** 



* Experience with financial modeling and investments.
* Familiarity with startup or small company dynamics.
* Knowledge or passion for the music industry or music royalty data.
* Skills in data visualization, creating clear and compelling narratives.
* Additional programming skills, such as JavaScript.
* Experience with cloud infrastructure.



  





**Why Join Us:** 



* **Flexible Working:** 
 Enjoy the option to work from our Stockholm office or remotely, allowing you to balance your professional and personal life.
* **Supportive Environment:** 
 Join a team that values empathy, respect, and collaboration, fostering an inclusive culture.
* **Transparent Compensation:** 
 We offer competitive salaries with clarity around compensation ranges, ensuring you know what to expect.
* **Impactful Work:** 
 Be part of a company that is redefining the music investment landscape through innovative, data-driven strategies.



  





 Join us at RUN, where you can contribute your unique talents to a diverse and dynamic team committed to making a positive impact in the music industry. Apply today, as we review applications on a rolling basis and look forward to hearing from you soon!

title: Teamlead
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**PostNord Group AB is a leading provider of communication and logistics solutions in the Nordic region.The Nordic Support department is responsible for enabling and ensuring the service management in Group function IT. The unit contributes with designing processes, concepts and implementing them in the service management areas to ensure that the processes provide desired business result.** 




  





**Position Overview:** 




 Do you want to be part of a dynamic and rapidly changing environment at one of the Nordic region´s largest companies? Are you interested to lead guide and support a team of system administrators and engineers toward achieving specific goals and objective this is the job for you!
 



  





 As a Team Lead in System Operations, you will be responsible for leading a team of system administrators and engineers to ensure the smooth functioning and reliability of the organization's IT infrastructure. Your primary focus will be on managing daily operations, coordinating tasks, and providing technical guidance to team members. You will play a pivotal role in optimizing system performance, implementing best practices, and driving continuous improvement initiatives to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of system administrators and engineers offshore.
* Goal Setting: Define team goals, objectives, and priorities aligned with organizational objectives.
* Incident and Problem Management: Lead incident response efforts and conduct root cause analysis for major incidents.
* Change Management: Manage change requests and coordinate system changes, ensuring adherence to processes.
* Performance Monitoring: Implement monitoring tools and analyze system metrics to optimize performance.
* Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of system configurations and procedures.
* Knowledge Sharing: Promote knowledge sharing and best practices within the team.



  





**We are looking for you who have** 




  




* Fundamental knowledge in AWS cloud platform, DevOps, cloud operations
* Jira software, confluence and service management
* Prior experience as team lead in a global organization
* ITIL principles and foundation knowledge
* MS Office



  





**Meritorious experience:** 



* Knowledge in Azure cloud platform
* Team lead experience preferably in a technology or cybersecurity environment



  





 We believe you are curious and motivated to learn new things – open to opportunities for further training and education. Strong communication skills, with the ability to engage team.
 



  





**We Offer You** 
 :
 


* Work in a Nordic and dynamic environment
* Wellness allowance & access to the office´s gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord´s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus
* Great occupational pension terms
* Great development opportunities



  





**We make everyday life easier** 




 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
 



 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com
 



  





**Apply** 




 Welcome with your application. Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. In this recruitment, PostNord collaborates with Experis IT, which has extensive experience in recruiting IT specialists and managers. If you have any questions or need more information, please contact Recruitment Consultants Carina Eyoma at carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, +46 73-086 22 75 and Pia Boström pia.bostrom@se.experis.com, +46 70-3146866
 



 We look forward to receive your application!
 



 For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga
 



  





 We are looking forward to hear from you!

title: Data Engineer - AWS, Redshift, Python & SQL
description:
**About Us**
 Sinch is a global leader in cloud communications, helping businesses connect with their customers on mobile phones. We facilitate over 147 billion conversations annually, reaching every phone on Earth. Our technology powers the world's leading communication platforms.
   

  

 We are a dynamic and innovative team seeking a passionate Data Engineer to collaborate on our data pipeline and data warehousing solutions.
   

  

 The working model is hybrid, and you can work from our Stockholm or Malmo office.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain scalable, resilient data pipelines using AWS services such as Lambda, Step Functions, Redshift, and S3.
* Improve and maintain the Redshift data warehouse solution.
* Manage the data lifecycle from ingestion and processing to storage and retrieval.
* Work with a range of different technologies and programming languages, with a primary focus on Python and SQL.
* Actively contribute to enhancing our data processes and pipelines.
* Take a hands-on approach to monitoring production environments, identifying issues, and being on-call when necessary.
* Engage closely with data scientists, software engineers, architects, DevOps specialists, and product managers to deliver exceptional data solutions.
* Build and maintain visualizations and dashboards in Tableau.


**Requirements**
* Capable of developing, maintaining, and optimizing data pipelines for enhanced performance and reliability.
* Experienced professional in team-based software development and deployment.
* Skilled in using SQL for data querying and ETL/ELT development.
* Experienced in data warehousing (Redshift) and data modelling.
* In-depth knowledge of AWS services including Lambda, Step Functions, Redshift, and S3.
* Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional self-organizing team, fostering collaboration and mutual respect among team members.
* A passion for writing clean and efficient code.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, data engineering, or related technical discipline.


 Good to have
   

  

* Knowledgeable about various data architectures such as Data Lake, Data Mesh, and Data Fabric.
* Experience in data visualization tools.
* Knowledge in or willing to learn infrastructure as code using Terraform.
* Experience in a similar industry or related one.
* Proven ability to work with others to solve tough technical problems.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment characteristic of agile development methodologies.
* Experience guiding and mentoring fellow engineers, empowering them to contribute effectively to team goals.


 Embrace the challenge and join us!

title: Data Center Regional Mechanical Engineer (Field Engineering), Field Engineering
job_function: Project Management, Management, and Product Management
description:
**Description**
 As an Amazon Field Engineer, you will provide full life-cycle support to AWS Data Centers from design inception through site improvement and maintenance. You will be the ‘go to’ engineering resource for your region when technical advice is needed, and will use your subject matter expertise and engage with diverse teams to:
   

  

* Perform design and equipment submittal review for new Data Centers in your region.
* Troubleshoot, conduct Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and create Corrective Action (CA) documentation for site/equipment failures.
* Directly support operational issues with ad-hoc training, complex operating procedure reviews, including critical equipment, and event support.
* Own the conceptual design for existing data center upgrades and design-solutions, which add capacity, improve availability, increase efficiency and sustainability.
* Interface with internal data center operations team, data center design engineering team, server hardware team, environmental health and safety team to promote standards that maintain consistency and reliability in services delivered.
* Develop innovative solutions for AWS’s data centers.
* Work on concurrent projects, sometimes in multiple geographical regions.
* Initiate and lead engineering audits including on-site visits within Amazon’s data centers. Produce reports outlining risks with recommended mitigations and remediations.
* Act as resident engineer during new construction projects. Support construction, commissioning, and turnover.


 AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
   

  

 You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

**Role**
 Amazon's vision is to be the world's most customer-centric company, and this role is key to that vision. As a Field Engineer, you will be leading projects to fit out our data centers to meet ever-evolving customer needs as we continue expanding our fleet to hyper-scale. As an ideal candidate you:
   

  

* Possess Strong Engineering Judgement and are able to provide recommendations despite uncertainty/ambiguity.
* Are detail and data oriented.
* Have experience solving problems with engineered solutions.
* Have experience managing engineering projects and consultants.
* Build trust and relationships with different stakeholders (e.g., Operations, Controls, Construction, Design, Commissioning, Product Managers, Technical Program Managers, ).
* Are adaptable and inclined to get into the field to see things up close. Excited about a mix of office and field work.


 A day in the life
   

  

 Each day you will interact with different teams responsible for all aspects of the data centers. You will prioritize your activities to support data center capacity availability and safety focusing on the actions that are most impactful. You will have the opportunity to work on projects locally and globally.
   

  

 If you meet these qualifications, exude passion, and enjoy the challenge of innovative projects at hyper-scale, this job is for you!
   

  

**About The Team**
 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent experience.
* Experience with data center, or similar industry, mechanical equipment, including but not limited to AHUs, CRAHs, DX units, Generators, Pumps, Evaporative Cooling


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Coursework in commercial/industrial mechanical systems with experience with psychometric theory, calculations and practical application
* Organized and have the ability to set priorities and meet deadlines and budget
* Possess leadership and problem-solving skills. Possess excellent communication and writing skills, attention to detail, maintain high quality standards
* Experience using a variety of web based and other software tools for calculation and data processing.
* Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Data Services Sweden AB
   

  

 Job ID: A2801530

title: Lead machine learning engineer
description:
**How we work**

We are a tight group of talented (arguably), fun (subjectively) and creative (definitively) people pushing the boundaries of product and business development. We are ambitious, but more importantly curious. We ask questions. We try things. We ideate and iterate. And sometimes, we even argue. Because we *feel* for the things we build.

But most of all, we support each other. We laugh a lot. And we strive to make sure every person is really looking forward to coming into the office, every day. However, we also value freedom highly, and will cater to your needs whenever you need work to be flexible.

**What we look for**

You are a driven engineer who is excited to be part of our journey scaling Napper. You learn fast and are not afraid to take on new technical challenges. You actively seek responsibility and get motivated by complex problems and big tasks. You are looking for a job where you can advance your career fast and get well compensated for the hard work you put in. You love working with data and machine learning, and find joy in creating outstanding user experiences.

Our philosophy is to hire selectively and invest heavily in the people who work with us. If you become one of us - we’ll go above and beyond to make sure you find your work meaningful, inspiring, and stimulating, and feel fully supported by both your peers and superiors. We will evaluate your performance quarterly and re-negotiate your salary twice a year.

**What you will be doing**

You will work hand in hand with the CTO and CEO on developing production-ready features using machine learning. Leading ML engineering at Napper, you will own the full machine learning lifecycle, from developing data pipelines for hundreds of millions of baby sleep logs to applying the latest research to improve our sleep prediction engine. During product development, you will bring the data perspective and identify unique opportunities that can be achieved using your experience in machine learning. We don't believe in micromanagement – you'll have the freedom to tackle challenges with your creative solutions and problem-solving expertise.

**Requirements**

* 4+ years of experience working with data engineering and machine learning
* Demonstrable experience in leading machine learning projects from start to finish.
* Proficiency in Python, SQL and widely used machine learning and data engineering libraries (PyTorch, PySpark, Scikit-learn etc.)
* Team player who can work independently and proactively propose solutions when faced with ambiguous software engineering problems
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills

**Nice to have**

* Experience with AWS and infrastructure as code

What are you waiting for? We’d love to hear from you!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: 70 000,00kr - 90 000,00kr per month

Ability to commute/relocate:

* 118 46 Stockholm: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

Application Deadline: 15-12-2024  
Expected Start Date: 01-01-2025

title: Embedded Electronics Engineer - Elektronikutvecklare
description:
Jobbeskrivning


Brinner du för teknik och innovation, och vill arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom hårdvaruutveckling? Då kan denna roll vara precis rätt för dig! Vi söker nu en Embedded Electronics Engineer som kommer att spela en viktig roll i vårt växande team inom Products & Software Engineering. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta med avancerad elektronik i teknikens framkant, där du tillsammans med vårt team kommer att konstruera och utveckla framtidens system.


I denna roll kommer du att få jobba i en varierad arbetsmiljö med tillgång till vårt eget labb och i samarbete med våra kunder inom ett brett spektrum av branscher såsom försvar, medicinteknik, telekom och fordon. Du kommer att vara involverad i hela utvecklingsprocessen – från konceptutveckling och prototypframtagning till färdig produkt. Rollen innebär både inhouse-arbete på vår produktutvecklingsavdelning i Göteborg och ute hos våra kunder, vilket ger dig möjlighet att både bredda och fördjupa din kompetens.


Vi är ett team som värdesätter samarbete och gemenskap högt. Här på AFRY vill vi att våra medarbetare ska trivas, känna sig trygga och ha roligt på jobbet. Vi tror på att skapa en arbetsmiljö där det finns stora möjligheter till utveckling, både professionellt och personligt, och där du får vara med och påverka.


Kvalifikationer


Du har ett genuint intresse för elektronik och teknik samt en naturlig nyfikenhet för att lösa tekniska utmaningar. Vi söker dig som är trygg i din roll som hårdvaruutvecklare och har erfarenhet inom området. Du uppskattar både det praktiska arbetet i labb och den tekniska utmaningen i att utveckla innovativa lösningar för våra kunder. Du trivs i en miljö där du kan arbeta både självständigt och i team, och ser värdet av att dela med dig av din kunskap och lärdomar till dina kollegor.


För att trivas i denna roll ser vi gärna att du har:

* Flera års erfarenhet av hårdvaruutveckling och elektronikkonstruktion.
* Erfarenhet av områden som PCBA-utveckling, ASIC/FPGA, DC/DC, Embedded SW, testning och/eller EMC-mätteknik.
* Ett intresse för att arbeta i elektroniklabb för utveckling och testning.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i team och en vilja att utvecklas tillsammans med kollegor och kunder.
* Meriterande erfarenhet av verktyg som Altium, Cadence och/eller OrCAD.


För denna tjänst är det ett krav att du behärskar både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift, då våra uppdrag ofta innefattar kontakt med svenska kunder. Vissa uppdrag kan också vara säkerhetsklassade, vilket innebär att du behöver inneha ett medborgarskap från en nation ansluten till NATO.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och tror att du är en person som uppskattar utmaningar, har ett starkt engagemang och är prestigelös i ditt sätt att samarbeta med andra. Du motiveras av att arbeta i en miljö där vi alla tar ansvar för att skapa en positiv arbetskultur och där gemenskap och samarbete är i fokus.


Företagsbeskrivning


AFRY är ett ledande europeiskt företag med global räckvidd inom teknik, design och rådgivning. Vi hjälper våra kunder att accelerera omställningen mot ett hållbart samhälle. Vi är över 19 000 dedikerade experter inom infrastruktur, industri, energi och digitalisering och arbetar med att skapa hållbara lösningar för kommande generationer.


Ytterligare information


Hos AFRY får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en inspirerande och innovativ miljö där du kan växa både professionellt och personligt. Vi värdesätter våra medarbetares trivsel och erbjuder en trygg anställning med bra förmåner. AFRY har ett starkt fokus på kompetensutveckling och vi erbjuder både interna och externa utbildningar för att du ska kunna fortsätta utvecklas inom ditt område.


Vi erbjuder även:

* En trygg anställning med kollektivavtal och konkurrenskraftiga löner.
* En flexibel arbetsmiljö med frihet under ansvar och balans mellan jobb och fritid.
* Möjlighet till personlig och professionell utveckling via AFRY Academy eller externa kurser.
* Tillgång till Club AFRY med aktiviteter som skidresor, yoga, kultur- och sportevenemang.
* En inkluderande arbetsmiljö där våra ledare stöttar dig i din utveckling och där innovation och samarbete uppmuntras.


Ansökan  

Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-11-30. Intervjuer sker löpande, så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag!


Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta oss gärna:

* Lasse Holmberg - Sektionschef, lasse.holmberg@afry.com
* Fredrik Lillbäck – Rekryterare, fredrik.lillback@afry.com


Vi tackar för visad hänsyn om att inte bli kontaktade av externa leverantörer för rekryteringslösningar och liknande då dessa sköts enligt avtal på bolagsnivå.

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Lead Mechanical Engineer
description:
Do you want to join a developing journey with new concepts, new thinking, and innovative solutions to make a better world? At EasyMining, we develop technologies, design, and build processes that enable circular solutions for vital nutrients. If you have experience as a Mechanical Engineer and, after reading this job brief, feel intrigued to join our engineering team in the heart of Gothenburg, we encourage you to apply.  

  

**Job Brief**



We are looking for a candidate to join our mechanical team who is eager to take responsibility for the mechanical development of our various technologies. Our projects span all phases, from feasibility studies to plant start-up.



The primary work tasks include leading mechanical engineering project management, working on P&IDs, plant layouts, and 3D designs, specifying equipment, coordinating with vendors, and ensuring adherence to internal standards. In addition to mechanical expertise, the successful candidate will contribute to the development of the mechanical aspect of our engineering tool (COMOS). We believe the ideal candidate is a team player who respects deadlines, takes ownership of problem-solving tasks and projects, and has a strong desire to learn new things.


**Main Responsibilities**


* Lead mechanical engineering efforts across our project’s basic and detailed engineering, construction, commissioning, and plant start-up phases.
* Define the specifications for mechanical equipment design.
* Lead the development and setup of the mechanical part of our engineering tool (COMOS).
* Coordinate the work of external consultants to ensure accurate execution and timely delivery across project phases.
* Conduct design reviews to ensure compliance with standards, contracts, and legal requirements.
* Support management in budgeting and cost estimates in collaboration with our cross-functional engineering team.
* Develop and maintain internal mechanical standards.


 Most of the time will be spent in Gothenburg but may in the future involve traveling both national and international to our offices as well as being briefly located at the future sites as a part of a plant start-up team. Future travel is expected to be within Sweden and other parts of northern Europe.


**We offer you**



A stimulating and challenging job where you will have the opportunity to develop skills and abilities together with motivated co-workers in a cross-functional team. You will take part in an innovation journey towards developing and realizing new recovery technologies as well as improving our existing ones.


**Requirements**


* You are a driven and can work with structure, both independently and in a cross-functional team
* Excellent knowledge of mechanical engineering and good knowledge of related disciplines
* You are a team player, but you are also capable of working and come to results on your own.
* Physically capable of field work and site walk in an operating chemical plant that handles hazardous chemicals
* Can document the development process progress in an organized manner
* Can handle confidential information


**Education & Experience Requirements**



Higher level of education within Mechanical Engineering or similar



At least 5 years of relevant experience in an engineering environment. You need to have experience from either chemical, petrochemical, pulp & paper or the mining industries.



Knowledge of EN codes and PED.



Good knowledge of using MS Office package, AutoCAD or equivalent.



It is of benefit if you have experience of:


* Design work by engineering tool systems such as Comos.
* E3D or equivalent modelling software
* Experience of project leading
* Knowledge of different filter technic and rotation equipment
* Market vendor contacts of pumps, filters, reactors, agitators, scrubbers, and mixer-settlers.
* Site supervision, field work and installation


**Language skills**



Fluent English skills (requirement)



Swedish (requirement)



German (benefit)


**Further information**



EasyMining Sweden AB has been a company in the Ragn-Sells group since 2014. Ragn-Sells is a Swedish waste and recycling company operating in 5 countries with an annual turnover of above 800 M€ and approximately 2500 employees.



EasyMining is today employing 55 persons that is planned to grow to 60 during 2025. The engineering and management are located in an office in central Gothenburg, the R&D and Market are situated with office and laboratory facilities in Uppsala, and our German office is located in Berlin.



Apply by ANSÖK below. Deadline is set to 24th of November, but we will look into the applications continuously. Please send in an CV, a personal letter, and if relevant, your academic grades. If you are living outside of Sweden, please explain in the personal letter why you are interested to move to Sweden and why that practically (life situation) would work for you. If you have any further questions please contact Johan Möller, Discipline Leader Mechanical & Piping, Johan.Moller@ragnsells.com or John Svärd, Head of Engineering, John.svard@ragnsells.com.

title: Electric Power Engineer
description:
**Join Us in Transforming the Future!**  


It all starts with people. People like you.  


**Join Our Team**  


At Epiroc, we aim to produce the world’s greenest machines, using the greenest cells and metals, all for a better planet. We’re leading the way in sustainable mining with battery-electric, zero-emission equipment. Want to be part of this journey? Work with advanced mobile machines, electric drivetrains, and tackle new challenges in sophisticated control systems and automation.  


**Your Mission**  


We’re seeking engineers with expertise in electrical and software-based systems. Your role will involve developing, implementing, and adapting our electrical systems in terms of hardware, system architecture, and functionality to meet future performance, availability, and safety requirements. You`ll work with varius development from product maintenance to base development with low TRL level. You’ll collaborate closely with Global R&D and with customers and suppliers worldwide. Key tasks include creating solutions based on functional requirements, specifying and developing components with sub-suppliers, and verifying final product performance.  


**Your Profile**  


The ideal candidate brings:  


* University degree in a relevant field or equivalent engineering background.
* Professional experience in VCA 24V hardware for control systems.
* Professional experience in VCB 400-1000VAC and 700VDC.
* Knowledge of mobile electrical systems, control systems, and system architectures.
* Experience with software development, AutoCAD, Simulink simulation is a merit.
* Ability to take ideas from concept to production.
* English in a profesional level and basic understanding of Swedish is a must.


We are looking for a self-motivated, responsible, and deadline-oriented person with a structured and analytical approach, combining theory and practice. Strong interpersonal skills and teamwork orientation are a must.  


**Location and Travel**  


This position is based in Örebro, Sweden. In case a candidate from a different country applies and is successful, Swedish local terms and conditions will apply.  


**Life at Epiroc**  


Join us for a creative, innovative, and diverse workplace. Be part of a team that values Collaboration, Commitment, and Innovation. We offer:  


* Global career opportunities
* Epiroc University for skill development
* Community involvement
* Benefits package including flexible working hours and bonuses
* Hybrid workplace (up to 49%)

  


**Application and Contact Information**  


Submit your application as soon as possible through our online system. The last day to apply is November 22, 2024. We review applications continuously.  


Our recruitment process includes interviews, reference checks, and assessments. We conduct identity checks and drug and alcohol screening to ensure a safe working environment. Expect transparent communication and a fair evaluation of your skills and experience.  


For questions, contact:
* Hiring Manager Robert Thor: robert.Thor@epiroc.com
* Recruitment Specialist Zuzana Kalivodova: zuzana.kalivodova@epiroc.com

  


**Epiroc** is a global productivity partner for mining and construction customers, and accelerates the transformation toward a sustainable society. With ground-breaking technology, Epiroc develops and provides innovative and safe equipment, such as drill rigs, rock excavation and construction equipment and tools for surface and underground applications. The company also offers world-class service and other aftermarket support as well as solutions for automation, digitalization and electrification. Epiroc is based in Stockholm, Sweden, had revenues of more than SEK 60 billion in 2023, and has around 18 200 passionate employees supporting and collaborating with customers in around 150 countries. Learn more at www.epirocgroup.com.
